title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is addressed in the Act. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act, also known as the Farm Ownership Loans, amends eligibility requirements for farm loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. It includes provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act, or Farm Ownership Loans, amends farm loan eligibility requirements under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. It includes provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary, with changes in numbering and wording. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act, or Farm Ownership Loans, amends farm loan eligibility requirements under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act by including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Changes in numbering and wording are made to specify special rules regarding determinations. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act amends farm loan eligibility requirements to include provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities. Special rules are specified for determining the eligibility of operating-only entities that are owners of a family farm. The Secretary determines eligibility for entities owned by individuals who own the family farm, requiring at least 75 percent ownership by those individuals. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include eligibility for legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Farm operating loans now have revised eligibility requirements. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include eligibility for legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary, expanding eligibility for farm operating loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to expand eligibility for farm operating loans to legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to expand eligibility for farm operating loans to legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary, with special rules regarding ownership requirements. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include legal entities in eligibility for farm operating loans based on ownership by individuals who own the family farm. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include legal entities in eligibility for farm operating loans based on ownership by individuals who own the family farm, such as owner-operators or operators. The amendment also allows for limited liability companies or other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary to qualify for loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include legal entities like limited liability companies in eligibility for farm operating loans. The amendment specifies that owner-operators or operators of family farms can qualify for loans, as determined by the Secretary. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include legal entities like limited liability companies in eligibility for farm operating loans. The amendment specifies that owner-operators or operators of family farms can qualify for loans if they meet the direct ownership requirement. Amendments are made to sections 304(c)(2) and 310D(a) of the Act. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include legal entities like limited liability companies in eligibility for farm operating loans. Section 310D(a) is amended to expand eligibility to farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other legal entities. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include limited liability companies in eligibility for farm operating loans. The amendment also expands eligibility to farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include limited liability companies in eligibility for farm operating loans. The amendment also expands eligibility to farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments include changes to allow joint operators or owners in certain clauses. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include limited liability companies in eligibility for farm operating loans. The amendment also expands eligibility to farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments include changes to allow joint operators or owners in certain clauses. Section 359(c)(2) of the Act is amended to reflect these changes. The Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2006a(c)(2)) is amended to replace references to specific sections with more general clauses. SEC. 3 amends the purposes of certain direct loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act by allowing refinancing of loans made or guaranteed under this subtitle. SEC. 4 repeals certain loan term limits. SEC. 4 repeals certain loan term limits under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.
